summary: The Department of Energy has the difficult task of cleaning up hazardous and radioactive waste from energy research and nuclear weapons production dating to World War II. This report describes the estimated cost of this future cleanup—DOE's environmental liability—and related issues. The estimated future cost was $512 billion in FY 2020 Most of the liabilities ($406 billion of the total) are for cleanup activities managed...
title: Department of Energy: Environmental Liability Continues to Grow, but Opportunities May Exist to Reduce Costs and Risks
